name: flatfair
slogan: flatfair is a proptech startup on a mission to become the first digital tenancy mediator
description:
Tenancy deposits are a pain...

That's why we have partnered with industry leaders to build a product that would not have been possible 5 years ago, the flatbond - simple, affordable and secure alternative to tenancy deposits. 

After several months of development, we are ready to market and have just entered into negotiations with some of the largest letting agents in the UK.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Software Engineer (Scaling Start-Up)
jobs.description:
This is a unique opportunity to join a founding team and impact every renter in the UK through exciting and highly rewarding work.

Join us on our mission to create a world of deposit FREE renting!


We expect more people renting than ever before. That’s why we believe renting should be more affordable and accessible. We are a young and innovative startup company solving an affordability problem by offering deposit-free renting to millions of Tenants across the UK - with lots more exciting stuff to come.

We have built a core team and a product we are proud of, raised significant start capital and partnered with UK's largest independent letting agency.

We're building our engineering team of two to six in the coming months and looking to hire two full stack developers. 

Focus of the Role:

Day to day, you will be working on our core product: a dashboard used by tenants, landlords and agents to manage their tenancies. We’re a small company – as an engineer you'll be able to work directly with everyone on the team. You’ll have a chance to learn a lot not only about engineering but also about every detail of growing a young business. We love open source, we want to give back to the community so in addition to your standard holiday allowance you can take extra days of to contribute to your favourite open source projects.

Tech Stack:

Our project started as a django monolith. Initially we build all our views in pure HTML, CSS & JavaScript. Since then we’ve introduced Vue.js. We define our infrastructure using terraform and deploy to AWS, store data in postgres, use circleci for CI. Apart from our core app we're deploying services written in node.js using AWS Lambda  On a usual day you can expect to:

Key Responsibilities:

Work in a small team of developers and designers to build our core platform
Write HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Contribute to our django backend 
Create new services written in node.js
Collaborate with the team and help to decide how to improve our product
Think how to improve the way we work, iterate on the process and tools to make sure we take advantage of best practices and technology
Iterate and optimise products based on feedback and data analytics
Take ownership of your project by designing, building, maintaining and iterating new features and new products.

Requirements

The skills and experience you’ll likely have:

Relevant experience working in a Full-Stack role
Strong knowledge of Javascript, HTML and CSS
Interest in learning about backend and/or devops
Knowledge of unit and functional testing

Whats in it for you:

We offer the following benefits to all our employees (not to mention a fantastic work environment, inspiring colleagues and a ton of fun):
Stock options
Competitive salary (reviewed every year)
Flexible working hours
25 days paid annual leave
Weekly team lunch
Open kitchen with complimentary tea, coffee and snacks
Workplace pension scheme
Regular social events
The IT/hardware you need to get the job done
Learning and development allowance for conferences or courses
Dedicated time to contribute to open source
Awesome pet-friendly office in central London

Interview Process

Our interview process consists of an initial phone screen, a take-home code test, and a half-day on-site interview. We promise not to ask you any brain teasers or trick questions, and we won't make you code on a whiteboard!

jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
This is a unique opportunity to join a founding team and impact every renter in the UK through exciting and highly rewarding work. 

Join us on our mission to create a world of deposit FREE renting!

Flatfair is the UK’s fastest growing deposit alternative. Our mission is to make renting more affordable and accessible by offering deposit-free renting to millions of tenants across the UK, whilst still protecting landlords. Quite simply, we believe that better letting makes for better living.

We expect more people renting than ever before. That’s why we believe renting should be more affordable and accessible. We are a young and innovative startup company solving an affordability problem by offering deposit-free renting to millions of Tenants across the UK - with lots more exciting stuff to come.

We have built a core team and a product we are proud of, raised significant start capital and partnered with UK's largest independent letting agency.

As a Business Development Manager, you will closely work with our Commercial Director and the flatfair management team with one primary goal: to help flatfair meet its ambitious growth targets. You will be expected to help develop new business while sustaining the company’s culture and dynamic working environment.

Requirements
Focus of the role?

Developing new and innovative ways to help grow flatfair through strategic partnerships 
Work across cross-functional teams to further develop your assigned agencies
Identifying, attracting, negotiating and launching partnerships with complex and influential companies that Flatfair needs to build functionality and brand awareness
Use data to analyse success; predicting and managing evolution of our relationships – building and fostering deep relationships with partner executives, their customer CxOs and Flatfair leaders
Defining, reviewing and agreeing to a clear set of priorities, joint initiatives and roadmap with our largest partners
Delivering against assigned quarterly targets on new and existing business 
Focus on an outstanding sales experience to flatfair's top managed agencies, strategic business partners and suppliers.

Key responsibilities?

Owning and strengthening primary agency, partners and suppliers relationships from executive C/B-level down to specific account teams
Being an ongoing thought partner for agencies, partners and suppliers by leading on strategic initiatives and high level planning
Developing a go-to-market strategy in order to optimise flatfair’s solutions, technologies and products to help customers transform – working with these alliance partners in developing unique solutions that leverage their unique talents and go-to-market skills
Mentoring team members, guiding their immediate and long-term direction and results. Working collaboratively with the rest of Flatfair team in delivering long-term value through these partnerships.

The skills and experience you’ll likely have?

Experience in sales or marketing at an real-estate agency, property holding group, technology or proptech firm
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically
Experience in managing complex, multi-stakeholders and service based solutions
Preferably a BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience

Whats in it for you?

We offer the following benefits to all Flatfair employees

Stock options
Competitive salary reviewed every year
Choose your own equipment
Follow motivating career path, we value growth from within and encourage people to step-up
Flexible working hours, we embrace the occasional remote work
25 paid holiday days
Weekly team lunch
Snacks and fruits
Workplace pension scheme
Regular socials events
Learning budget for conferences or courses

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.description:
This is a unique opportunity to join a founding team and impact every renter in the UK through exciting and highly rewarding work. 

Join us on our mission to create a world of deposit FREE renting!

Flatfair is the UK’s fastest growing deposit alternative. Our mission is to make renting more affordable and accessible by offering deposit-free renting to millions of tenants across the UK, whilst still protecting landlords. Quite simply, we believe that better letting makes for better living.

We expect more people renting than ever before. That’s why we believe renting should be more affordable and accessible. We are a young and innovative startup company solving an affordability problem by offering deposit-free renting to millions of Tenants across the UK - with lots more exciting stuff to come.

We have built a core team and a product we are proud of, raised significant start capital and partnered with UK's largest independent letting agency.

Within our Accounts team you will partners closely with some of the largest landlords and agencies across the UK to develop a new renting experience that puts the tenant at its core. We're uniquely situated to help shape how these companies grow their businesses in the digital age. You will closely work with our commercial director with one primary goal: to help flatfair’s clients meet their ambitious growth targets. You would be expected to help develop new business while sustaining the company’s culture and dynamic working environment.

This role is perfect for someone with account management and operations experience who has a passion to work for a startup with ambitious goals.

Requirements

Focus of the role?

Acquiring and managing our key accounts to drive distribution and adoption of our products
Helping to define and create key processes by understanding our business methods and our customer needs
Helping to acquire, onboard deliver training and service new and existing partners (estate agents & build-to-rent operators)
Inputting feedback to tech teams to ensure flatfair is delivering industry leading products
Handling key accounts to ensure maximum take-up of flatfair products by partner’s landlords and renters by providing constant support & consultation
Key responsibilities?

Maintaining and nurturing business relationships with stakeholders  to ensure continuity of business growth
Delivering expert support with a focus on outstanding customer experience
Developing and improving process to help the business grow at scale
Assisting with training of new property partners to make them enthusiastic & knowledgeable about the benefits we bring
Stepping up to ensure targets are met and processes are improved

The skills and experience you’ll likely have?

Interest in the property or property tech industry 
Ability to speak and write in English idiomatically
Background in sales, account management or consulting
Passion for disruptive startups 

What’s in it for you:

We offer the following benefits to all Flatfair employees

Stock options
Competitive salary reviewed every year
Choose your own equipment
Follow motivating career path, we value growth from within and encourage people to step-up
Flexible working hours, we embrace the occasional remote work
25 paid holiday days
Weekly team lunch
Snacks and fruits
Workplace pension scheme
Regular socials events
Learning budget for conferences or courses
